UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Substitution of lysine for isoleucine at the center of the nonpolar face of the antimicrobial peptide, piscidin-1, leads to an increase in the rapidity of bactericidal activity and a reduction in toxicity.
Literature.Author: Taheri B, Mohammadi M, Momenzadeh N, Farshadzadeh Z, Roozbehani M, Dehghani P, Hajian S, Darvishi S, Shamseddin J

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human erythrocytes:60% Hemolysis=100 µg/ml,Human embryonic kidney HEK293 cells:30% Killing=50 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=3.1µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 10662(MIC=25µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=6.2µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=6.2µg/ml),Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 1435(MIC=3.1µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii(MIC=3.1µg/ml)
